intro: Luzula campestris subsp. pulchella, commonly known as the elegant wood rush, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, greenish-white flowers in dense clusters during the spring and summer months. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense colonies in suitable habitats.
